intro: Corydalis ananke, commonly known as the Ananke lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Fumariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has slender, hairy stems and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
